intro: Pseudibatia friesii, commonly known as the desert lily, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in arid and semi-arid environments, showcasing adaptations to drought conditions. The plant features a basal rosette of narrow, gray-green leaves that help reduce water loss. Its showy, bell-shaped flowers are typically pink or purple, blooming in spring. Pseudibatia friesii is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological role in supporting local wildlife.
